thread.title: Girls tennis: Cedar Grove Panthers fall to Nutley
thread.title_full: Girls tennis: Cedar Grove Panthers fall to Nutley

title: Girls tennis: Cedar Grove Panthers fall to Nutley
text:
Buy this photo thinkstock 
The Cedar Grove girls tennis squad fell to Nutley 4-1 at home Monday, Oct. 5. The loss brings the Panthers' record to 5-7 in 2015. 
Cedar Grove dropped all three singles contest. Junior Daniella Cordasco fell in the first singles match 2-6, 1-6. Senior Rachel Bucchino performed well, but couldn't get the victory in second doubles, falling in two sets 5-7, 0-6. Fellow senior Julia Corso was defeated in the third singles match 1-6, 0-6. 
The Panthers found some success in the doubles matches. Sophomores Elissa Johnson and Haley Diess nearly pulled out a victory in first doubles, but fell in three sets 4-6, 6-1, 5-7. Senior Ava Kresimer and sophomore Elissa Johnson earned the Panthers' only victory of the match and secured the second doubles game 6-4, 7-5.
